content.heading: HTML RGB and RGBA Colors
paragraphs: An RGB color value represents RED, GREEN, and BLUE light sources. An RGBA color value extends RGB with an Alpha channel for opacity.

content.heading: RGB Color Values
paragraphs: In HTML, a color can be specified as an RGB value using the formula: rgb(red, green, blue).
Each parameter (red, green, and blue) defines the intensity of the color with a value between 0 and 255.
This means there are 256 x 256 x 256 = 16,777,216 possible colors!
For example, rgb(255, 0, 0) is red, as red is set to its highest value (255) and the others are set to 0.
Similarly, rgb(0, 255, 0) is green, with green at its highest value (255) and the others at 0.
To display black, set all parameters to 0: rgb(0, 0, 0).
To display white, set all parameters to 255: rgb(255, 255, 255).

content.heading: Shades of Gray
paragraphs: Shades of gray are defined using equal values for all three parameters.
